Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2014 08:04PM - edited Feb 3, 2014 12:31AM by thekiwikid have you read Life In My Hands by Doctor Jane Plant  she also does a book called The Plant Programme I think she was stage 4 with months to live...she changed her diet and is alive to tell the tale a Grandmother now and cancer free. She does the daily juicing NO DIARY (this is her non negotiable) mainly veggie and fruit. It is an interesting read. I do one raw meal a day, I juice, have limited diary, meat and eat as many veggies and fruit as I can. Wont cure me but helps me manage chemo really well and apart from my stage 4 challenge I am fit and healthy....

Posts.Content: thekiwikid wrote: Hi Ladies - I finished my 18 weeks taxol 4 weeks ago and have continued on with Herceptin every three weeks. Two weeks ago I woke up and could not get out of bed! I have now had nearly two weeks off work and have very little energy to do anything. For the first few days I felt very sick, had a headache and was dizzy but those symptoms have all gone. I have no desire to do anything at all I get myself up and dressed each day but then spend most of the day watching TV or reading. I am sleeping fine at night and don't sleep during the day. I am also not that interested in food at all. I have done a lot of chemo treatments over the years and have never had fatigue like this before. Does anyone have any advise on how to manage this?? I am desperate to get back to normal life as soon as possible and also enjoy been off chemo. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2014 04:16AM - edited Mar 4, 2014 04:16AM by thekiwikid Hi sjww- I also started with sternum pain which was bone mets and have fluid around my left lung ( 2 litres drained in Oct did not really enjoy that !!) and liver mets. I have just finished 18 weeks taxol and Herceptin and will continue on with the Herceptin until I progress. My scan showed that I had responded well to the chemo with most liver mets gone and the ones left are much smaller. I agree with you that my liver mets are also what worry me the most. I wish you all the best for your new treatment I hope you get great results with minimal SE's . I found the taxol very manageable and continued to work and carry on with home life as normal. xxxx
